forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 56. South southeast wind 20 to 26 mph, with gusts as high as 43 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 18 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the night is cloaked in a veil of rain, as relentless as the whispers of autumn. The clouds hang low, casting the city in a muted palette, drenched in shades of gray. A brisk wind travels from the south, lending an invigorating chill to the damp air, while a steady rhythm of rain taps against the pavement, setting a somber yet serene tone. As the hour creeps towards midnight, the intoxicating scent of wet earth mingles with the faint glow of streetlights, creating an atmosphere both cozy and introspective.

Looking ahead, Thursday promises more of the same—a seemingly endless stretch of rain, with temperatures struggling to rise beyond the comfortable embrace of the low sixties before settling back into the cooler evening air. This is a day for layering; a light waterproof jacket over a soft sweater will serve well against the brisk winds and impending downpour. Perhaps take a stroll beneath a sturdy umbrella, allowing the rhythms of the rain to guide your steps. Explore the quiet corners of the city, perhaps drift into a local café to warm up with a cup of something rich, or lose yourself in the pages of a good book, with the steady patter outside as your companion. Embrace the coziness of the day, for in the heart of the storm lies an invitation to slow down and savor the present moment.
